shiddy joined #xwiki at 12:15  
shiddy - (12:15): hi  
shiddy - (12:16): how can i check, that a certain value of a xwiki class is never empty?  
shiddy - (12:16): can i use the regular expression validator of the class editor to set such a rule?  
shiddy - (12:16): ?  
venkatna left at 12:18 (Remote host closed the connection  
sdumitriu - (12:19): Hi shiddy  
shiddy - (12:19): hey sdumitriu  
sdumitriu - (12:19): You can use the validation regexp for that  
shiddy - (12:19): hmm i trief /.++/  
sdumitriu - (12:19): But it might fail with Save&Continue  
shiddy - (12:19): \*tried  
shiddy - (12:19): thats ok  
shiddy - (12:20): .++    so i have at least one random character that has to be inserted  
shiddy - (12:20): or is this the wrong expression?  
shiddy - (12:20): or without  the /xxx/  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 12:21  
sdumitriu - (12:22): Let me check  
shiddy - (12:22): thanks  
sdumitriu - (12:24): Hm, doesn't seem to work...  
shiddy - (12:25): yip  
SvenDowideit\_ joined #xwiki at 12:25  
SvenDowideit left at 12:25 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
SvenDowideit\_ is now known as SvenDowideit ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
sdumitriu - (12:31): So, something is broken  
sdumitriu - (12:33): There's another solution, but it's a bit more difficult  
sdumitriu - (12:34): It involves writing some Java code  
sdumitriu - (12:35): Using the Observation component, you would listen for all document saves and prevent saving when the document contains an invalid property  
shiddy - (12:36): hmm thats wo much work for such a little effect :D  
shiddy - (12:36): but perhaps u can fix it in one of the future versions

lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:40  
sburjan - (14:01): someone here that knows the DB and hibernate stuff within xwiki ?  
sdumitriu - (14:01): Me  
sburjan - (14:02): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DsXWikiDates  
sburjan - (14:03): I've looked with Florin at the config and I don'tsee nothing wrong there  
sburjan - (14:03): don't understand the remark under the table, what is wrong there ?  
sburjan - (14:03): I used 2.2.5, and they seem fine on this version  
florinciu left at 14:18 (Quit: Leaving.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 14:29  
lucaa - (15:02): guys, I'm playing around with the rss feed macro and I notice it has a default width set in pixels. Any idea about the rationale behind this  
lucaa - (15:02): ?  
lucaa - (15:02): it is a block macro, after all, right?  
sburjan - (15:14): Hello. I've found the flickr plugin in XWiki Core. I want to ask you if it's used by some app/module. If not, we could move it out of the core and maybe remove it from the bundle. (it's only a suggestion)  
cjdelisle - (15:15): Good day,  
cjdelisle - (15:15): (enter next to shift)   I think moving out the flickr plugin is a good idea.  
lucaa - (15:15): me too  
jvdrean - (15:15): +1  
lucaa - (15:16): I think the same, unless it's used somewhere  
lucaa - (15:16): but I really doubt that  
cjdelisle - (15:16): we could move it to the plugins section but I think it is better for that type of functionality to be handled on a application level  
cjdelisle - (15:16): !search flickr  
lucaa - (15:18): but what does the flickr plugin actually do?  
cjdelisle - (15:18): hmm FlickrUserMacro.   "bundled with all the XWiki products by default."  
lucaa - (15:19): so the plugin seems to be just a bridge to com.aetrion.flickr.Flickr  
lucaa - (15:19): then we should remove this one too...  
lucaa - (15:20): although it's a little hard...  
qwebirc36274 joined #xwiki at 15:23  
qwebirc36274 is now known as SiX-P4cK (d5f6ffbb@gateway/web/freenode/ip.213.246.255.187  
SiX-P4cK - (15:23): hi  
cjdelisle - (15:24): hu SiX-P4cK you're using the page on xwiki.org to access the chat?  
cjdelisle - (15:25): Not much response to "[proposal] add getDocumentURL to DocumentAccessBridge" can someone take a look at it, I need it to move xwiki-crypto into the tree.  
SiX-P4cK - (15:26): im using http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/IRC  
cjdelisle - (15:26): Cool. it wasn't working yesterday, I guess freenode fixed it.  
lucaa - (15:27): additionally, flickruser macro is not really really working  
lucaa - (15:27): I would say the lib is outdated  
SiX-P4cK - (15:27): someone already make class in xwiki?  
cjdelisle - (15:28): I'm find-grepping for flickr, it doesn't look like the flickruser macro even uses the flickr plugin.  
lucaa - (15:28): :)  
lucaa - (15:28): ah yes it doesn't I think  
lucaa - (15:28): lemme look at the impl  
cjdelisle - (15:29): "someone already make class in xwiki?" yes I have made a few classes, what question do you have?  
SiX-P4cK - (15:29): I make a new class with a property "endusers" of type List of Users.  
SiX-P4cK - (15:29): In edit mode of a new object, I can see all user in the select box.  
SiX-P4cK - (15:29): How to limit of a group of users named "endusergroup"?  
SiX-P4cK - (15:30): i hope you undestand my question  
lucaa - (15:30): SiX-P4cK:  you'd need to use the database list property and write the query to get the users yourself  
SiX-P4cK - (15:31): ok cool its possible first good news  
SiX-P4cK - (15:31): no link or sample or something?  
lucaa - (15:33): cjdelisle: yes, it seems the flickruser thing doesn't really use flickr plugin  
cjdelisle - (15:33): still find-grepping I'll be able to say if there is anything which uses it soon.  
SiX-P4cK - (15:34): sample founded ^^ http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/DatabaseListProperties  
lucaa - (15:36): SiX-P4cK: and then you should have http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/QueryGuide to help you around querying xwiki (with hsql)  
lucaa - (15:36): s/hsql/hql/  
SiX-P4cK - (15:36): yeah  
SiX-P4cK - (15:36): xwiki bug  
lucaa - (15:37): ?  
SiX-P4cK - (15:37): i try to create new property type database  
cjdelisle - (15:37): feature!  
SiX-P4cK - (15:37): click on ADD button  
SiX-P4cK - (15:38): java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList cannot be cast to java.lang.String at com.xpn.xwiki.objects.BaseStringProperty.setValue(BaseStringProperty.java:51)  
SiX-P4cK - (15:38): and many more  
SiX-P4cK - (15:38): try the same it's working now  
SiX-P4cK - (15:39): :( can't see my class in the xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiClasses now  
SiX-P4cK - (15:40): drop db on the way  
cjdelisle - (15:41): I find that it's easier to use simple features and build up your application in script.  
cjdelisle - (15:42): for example: I would use a simple static list and do the query in script then put the list of user names into that static list.  
cjdelisle - (15:42): Are you writing script?  
SiX-P4cK - (15:42): i try  
cjdelisle - (15:42): It's reasonably easy.  
sburjan - (15:42): ok. so what's new about the flickr stuff ? should I call a vote ?  
cjdelisle - (15:43): sburjan: at least a proposal.  
cjdelisle - (15:43): SiX-P4cK: Do you know any programming languages?  
sburjan - (15:43): cjdelisle,  : proposal to remove it from core in the plugins area, or to remove it entirely ?  
SiX-P4cK - (15:43): yeah usually i work in java/jsf/struts/gwt  
SiX-P4cK - (15:44): i have install xwiki this morning thats why i syx  
cjdelisle - (15:44): sburjan: I would be happiest to see it removed entirely since the plugin model is deprecated. still find-grepping for dependencies...  
lucaa - (15:45): sburjan: move it to contrib dead or something, for example  
sburjan - (15:45): okay, I'll wait until you confirm so I won't send an email to devs  
lucaa - (15:45): contrib dead aka retired  
lucaa - (15:46): give us the options in the mail, we'll vote for one or the other  
cjdelisle - (15:46): SiX-P4cK: Is the script that you write required to run with limited permissions or can it run with full admin permission?  
lucaa - (15:46): another option is to rewrite it nicely as a service and have it in core plugins still  
lucaa - (15:46): or in contrib alive  
lucaa - (15:46): a.k.a sandbox  
sburjan - (15:47): okay. I'll start writing the mail. cjdelisle : if you find some references that is still being used, please tell me  
cjdelisle - (15:47): ok.  
SiX-P4cK - (15:47): i have a feature usefull if you want: when you delete a page in a space index, return to the space index after delete  
lucaa - (15:47): u know it's part of the API, right? I mean even if it  
lucaa - (15:48): it's not used \_in xwiki\_, it could be used by someone in the wild who will be very very sad panda on upgrade  
SiX-P4cK - (15:51): cjdelisle: run with limited permission  
cjdelisle - (15:52): Ok, then you will have to program in velocity.  
SiX-P4cK - (15:52): i try tu do something to replace a collective excel page  
SiX-P4cK - (15:53): as collective can be excel ^^  
cjdelisle - (15:53): This will have you some information about our scripting interface: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
cjdelisle - (15:53): If you know java then you basically know velocity.  
cjdelisle - (15:54): http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html  
cjdelisle - (15:55): Velocity has it's own commands but when you have an object, you can treat it just like a java object (call methods etc.)  
SiX-P4cK - (15:59): thx  
cjdelisle - (16:01): ping sdumitriu jvelo lucaa vmassol Anyone opposed to this? "[proposal] add getDocumentURL to DocumentAccessBridge with boolean isFullURL to specify whether the url should be the external document url."  I would like to move crypto into the trunk today, this is holding it up.  
sburjan - (16:01): cjdelisle, : found anything ?  
cjdelisle - (16:02): sburjan: still find-grepping i'll have to mine the results after though. I think you're okay, send the mail anyway...  
sdumitriu - (16:02): cjdelisle: I'm 0 for the moment  
sdumitriu - (16:02): I don't like it that much, but it's needed  
jvelo - (16:02): fine by me cjdelisle . with action param too ?  
cjdelisle - (16:02): yes, with all existing parameters.  
lucaa - (16:03): cjdelisle: 0 as well. By default, I'm wondering if there's no other way to do it, but I didn't look into it so I have no clue...  
cjdelisle - (16:04): The other option is to use the equivilant getAttachmentUrl and regex the domain name from it and paste it into the document url D:  
asrfel left at 16:06 (Quit: Leaving.  
sburjan - (16:12): sdumitriu, : are you around ?

florinciu left at 16:59 (Read error: Connection reset by peer

jbrBridge - (17:48): \* members: Cindy Mitchell, Eduard Moraru, evalica, Ricardo Rodríguez  
abusenius - (18:06): argh, just spent an hour rebuilding xwiki back and forth because my changes in colibri were ignored just to find out that the web/standard/pm.xml specifies a wrong version...  
jvdrean - (18:09): fixing it, thanks for the catch  
sdumitriu left at 18:12 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 18:14  
abusenius - (18:14): jvdrean: could you also fix versions for other skins?  
jvdrean left at 18:17 (Quit: Leaving.  
evalica left at 18:20 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
tsziklay joined #xwiki at 18:37  
arkub left at 18:40 (Read error: Operation timed out  
KermitTheFragger left at 18:42 (Quit: Leaving  
sdumitriu left at 18:50 (Quit: Leaving.  
abusenius left at 18:54 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 19:07  
SiX-P4cK left at 19:26 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 19:41  
cjdelisle - (19:45): abusenius: /\*\* Unique SHA1 OID. TODO find a way to convert algorithm name to the corresponding OID \*/  
cjdelisle - (19:45): what does that TODO mean?  
abusenius - (19:45): some method needs the OID and not the algorithm name  
cjdelisle - (19:46): Why do you want to give it the algorithm name?  
abusenius - (19:46): and since OID is an random-looking number, I'd prefer having some method to convert human-readable algorithm name to OID  
cjdelisle - (19:47): CMSSignedGenerator.DIGEST\_SHA1 is readable to me.  
abusenius - (19:48): it might be that I found this constant later  
abusenius - (19:49): but it is not nice, e.g. hard to put it into configuration  
jvelo left at 19:51 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
cjdelisle - (19:51): It looks like it's this string...   "1.3.14.3.2.26"  
cjdelisle - (19:52): Maybe change the comment to something about "should this be configurable?"  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 19:52  
cjdelisle - (19:53): so long as it's static I see no need for it to be easier to read than that.  
abusenius - (19:54): yea, well, change the todo to whatever you like more  
Enygma` left at 19:57 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
cjdelisle - (20:04): crypto is moved to the core.  
abusenius - (20:12): great  
vmassol left at 20:14 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
cjdelisle - (20:36): what is XWIKI-582 all about? There's no description.  
lucaa left at 20:44 (Ping timeout: 258 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 21:32  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 21:35  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 21:48  
vmassol left at 21:49 (Client Quit  
jvelo left at 21:51 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 21:53  
sdumitriu - (22:36): cjdelisle: Updated description for XWIKI-582  
cjdelisle - (22:37): I'm thinking they should be converted as the user logs in.  
cjdelisle - (22:37): Because converting from hash to scrypt has the problem that we can't revert the hash.  
sdumitriu - (22:37): Hm, you can't read the hash  
sdumitriu - (22:37): How can you convert from hash to scrypt?  
cjdelisle - (22:38): When the user logs in we have their plaintext.  
sdumitriu - (22:38): Ah, you mean when you can't read the old value to automatically convert it  
cjdelisle - (22:39): I'm thinking about implementing that in the passwd verification function code, haven't gotten around to it yet.  
cjdelisle - (22:39): It will be a little while before scrypt is out of date anyway.  
jvelo left at 22:55 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds
